alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 14 at 1:20PM MST until July 14 at 3:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The Pipeline Burn Scar in... Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 330 PM MST. * At 116 PM MST, emergency management reported continued flooding across the Pipeline Burn Scar. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen and residual flash flooding and continued debris flow is expected along the Government Tank Wash. This flooding and debris flow will seep into portions of Doney Park. Portions of U.S. Highway 89 remain closed northeast of Flagstaff. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding and debris flows. SOURCE...Emergency management reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding and debris flow in and around the Pipeline Burn Scar. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Flagstaff, Doney Park, Timberline, Hutchison Acres and Little Elden Spring Horse Camp. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 89 between mile markers 423 and 427. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... San Francisco Wash and Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Avoid recently burned areas and downstream locations. Life-threatening flooding of creeks, roads and normally dry washes will occur. Rockslides and mudslides will likely occur in steep terrain.
